questions: What is the capital of Vietnam?
answers: Hanoi is the capital of Vietnam. It is located in the northern part of the country and has been the capital since 1976.
Pho is a Vietnamese soup dish consisting of broth, rice noodles, herbs, and meat, usually beef or chicken.
Vietnam was unified on April 30, 1975, when Saigon fell to North Vietnamese forces, ending the Vietnam War.
contexts: Hanoi is the capital of Vietnam.
Vietnam is a country in Southeast Asia.
Hanoi has been the capital of Vietnam since 1976 after reunification.
Pho is a Vietnamese soup consisting of broth, rice noodles (bánh phở), herbs, and meat.
It is one of the most popular dishes in Vietnamese cuisine.
Pho can be served with beef (phở bò) or chicken (phở gà).
The Fall of Saigon was the capture of Saigon by North Vietnam on April 30, 1975.
This event marked the end of the Vietnam War and the reunification of Vietnam.
Vietnam was officially reunified as the Socialist Republic of Vietnam on July 2, 1976.
ground_truths: Hanoi is the capital of Vietnam.
Pho is a traditional Vietnamese soup made with broth, rice noodles, herbs, and meat.
Vietnam was unified on April 30, 1975, after the Fall of Saigon.
